Posts.Content: roby7 wrote: hi Hi, I finished chemo ( taxotere and cytoxan) on 3/19 On the first day of April I had a strange sensation in the clitoris area. I started tamoxifen after that so the chemo is the reason. My symptoms developed and now they are Urgency and frequency I always have the urge to urinate for two month now Pressure and discomfort in the urethra area Sore clitoris Urine burning some days This is really hard and annoying I went to different doctors gynecologist and urologist Took several medicines But all of them said it is from cytoxan no one gave me other reason The tests and the ultrasound are fine no uti One of the doctors said interstitial cystitis I am really depressed The symptoms are annoying I stopped lyrica and Advil I started Estrace cream as my oncologist said that Any advice?? Wish u all the best Thanks, Dx 10/16/2014, DCIS, Right, 6cm+, Stage 0, Grade 3, 2/8 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 11/18/2014 Lymph node removal: Right, Sentinel, Underarm/Axillary; Mastectomy: Right; Reconstruction (right): DIEP flap Chemotherapy 1/14/2015 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Hormonal Therapy 4/1/2015 Tamoxifen pills (Nolvadex, Apo-Tamox, Tamofen, Tamone) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: interstitial cystitis after chemo anyone ? roby7 Italychick

Posts.Content: roby7 wrote: Hi, Two years ago I had a mastectomy in my right breast, chemotherapy and tamoxifen. In February 2016 I had a diep flap surgery then in October 2016 I had nipple reconstruction and repair hernia that developed after diep flap. I had pain in several place especially my right scapula and doing physical therapy but also I have pain in my reconstructed breast which I sstrange because no nervs there is it normal? Dx 10/16/2014, DCIS, Right, 6cm+, Stage 0, Grade 3, 2/8 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 11/18/2014 Lymph node removal: Right, Sentinel, Underarm/Axillary; Mastectomy: Right; Reconstruction (right): DIEP flap Chemotherapy 1/14/2015 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Hormonal Therapy 4/1/2015 Tamoxifen pills (Nolvadex, Apo-Tamox, Tamofen, Tamone) Log in to post a reply
